intro: Suchtelenia calycina var. acanthocarpa, commonly known as the spiny-fruited bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique feature is the spiny, woody capsule that develops from the flower, which contains the seeds. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture.
